intro: Fleischmannia laxicephala, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as succulent leaves and deep root systems to conserve water. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive hooded structure. Fleischmannia laxicephala plays a role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
